bundle.name: GCP CloudGuard Best Practices
bundle.description: CloudGuard Best Practices for securing GCP Account

rule.name: Ensure Private Google Access is enabled for all subnetworks in VPC Network
rule.description: Private Google Access enables virtual machine instances on a subnet to reach Google APIs and services using an internal IP address rather than an external IP address. External IP addresses are routable and reachable over the Internet. Internal (private) IP addresses are internal to Google Cloud Platform and are not routable or reachable over the Internet. You can use Private Google Access to allow VMs without Internet access to reach Google APIs, services, and properties that are accessible over HTTP/HTTPS.
rule.remediation:
**From Portal**
1. Go to VPC network GCP Console visiting https://console.cloud.google.com/networking/networks/list
2. Click the name of the network that contains the subnet.
3. Click the name of the subnet. The Subnet details page is displayed.
4. Click on EDIT button
5. Set Private Google access to On
6. Click on Save

**From TF**
Set the private_ip_google_access argument to 'true':
```
resource "google_compute_subnetwork" "container_subnetwork" {
...
private_ip_google_access = true
...
}
```

**From Command Line**
Run
```
gcloud compute networks subnets update SUBNET_NAME --region=REGION --enable-private-ip-google-access
```

**References**
1. https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/google/latest/docs/resources/compute_subnetwork
2. https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/configure-private-google-access
